title: Maruti Alto K10 price starts at Rs 4.23 lakh with 6 airbags update
description: The Maruti Alto K10 now comes with 6 airbags, which is standard across the range. With this update, the prices of the Alto K10 have increased by up to Rs 16,000, depending on the variant. Maruti has also changed the names of the Alto K10’s variants, removing the (O) suffix across the range. The entry-level Alto K10 STD now costs Rs 14,000 more, while LXI, VXI and VXI+ variants cost Rs 6,000, Rs 16,000 and Rs 10,000 more, respectively. html:
Alto K10 prices have increased by up to Rs 16,000 with 4 more airbags.

The Maruti Alto K10 now comes with 6 airbags, which is standard across the range. With this update, the prices of the Alto K10 have increased by up to Rs 16,000, depending on the variant. Maruti has also changed the names of the Alto K10’s variants, removing the (O) suffix across the range. However, there are no mechanical updates – the 67hp, 1.0-litre petrol engine that’s E20-fuel-compatible, with its manual and AMT options, continues, as does the factory-fitted CNG version. 

  1. Maruti Alto K10 prices have increased by Rs 6,000-16,000
  2. Standard safety kit includes 6 airbags, ESP, ABS, EBD
  3. Maruti claims 46 lakh Altos have been sold in India
Maruti Alto K10 price, ex-showroom, India (in Rs, lakh)
VariantNew priceOld priceDifference
Standard4.234.090.14
LXI5.004.940.06
VXI5.315.150.16
VXI+5.605.500.10
VXI AMT5.815.650.16
LXI CNG5.905.840.06
VXI+ AMT6.106.000.10
VXI CNG6.216.050.16

Maruti Alto K10 prices in 2025

Alto K10 VXI variants see the highest price hike

Just like it did with the Celerio and Brezza after updating them with 6 airbags, Maruti has raised the prices of the Alto K10, though not to the same degree. The entry-level Alto K10 STD now costs Rs 14,000 more, while LXI, VXI and VXI+ variants cost Rs 6,000, Rs 16,000 and Rs 10,000 more, respectively.

Maruti Alto K10 safety kit

3-point seat belts for rear passengers also added 

Besides 6 airbags, the Maruti Alto K10’s safety suite includes rear parking sensors, 3-point seat belts for all rear passengers, luggage-retention crossbars, electronic stability program (ESP), anti-lock braking system (ABS) and electronic brake-force distribution (EBD).  

Maruti Alto K10 sales and buyers

74 percent of Maruti Alto K10 buyers are first-timers

Maruti Suzuki has sold over 46 lakh units of the Alto since the budget hatchback arrived in India way back in 2000. The company’s senior marketing and sales executive, Partho Banerjee, also said that 74 percent of Alto K10 buyers are first-timers.
